page.title: 16Rogart - Farming (Forestry)
page.content: Twenty-five years ago, the Forestry Commission planted three woods on the Drynach in Rogart. Altogether, they planted around 880,000 plants. They planted different varieties of trees - Scot's pine, European larch, Japanese larch, Hybrid larch and Lodge-pole pine. When these trees were planted, three houses had to be evacuated. If the people had stayed there, the fire-risk to the forests would have been too high. Today, these houses are uninhabitable. The hillside is planted to a height of 800ft. Above this, the Forestry Commission have discovered the land in Rogart is uneconomic for tree-planting. When the trees are mature, they will be felled and taken by road to be made into wood-pulp and thence to paper.
